visual.name: smartFilterProByOKViz
visual.description: Smart Filter Pro by OKVIZ is the premium version of Smart Filter.

author.name: OKVIZ - a trademark of OKVIZ corp.

dataRoles.description: Set the column/measure(s) to search for. Each item you bind here is rendered in the report as a separate input text field. Search mode supports a single field only.
dataRoles.name: Values

dataRoles.description: Set the measure to display for each value of each field. Works only with Dropdown/Observer/Hierarchy modes.
dataRoles.name: SumValues

dataRoles.description: Set additional measures to be included in the items tooltips.
dataRoles.name: Tooltips

telemetry.description: Send anonymous non-personal data to OKVIZ for analytics purposes.

updates.description: Check if there is a new version of the visual and display a message - Editing view only.

consolidateFields.description: Render a single input box for multiple columns. Use the syntax COLUMN:QUERY to execute queries. E.g: Category:Audio

maxIncremental.description: Choose how many rows the visual can retrieve from the data set. Note that retrieving more than 30,000 rows may slow down the entire report. Set '0' to retrieve all the data.

maxResults.description: Choose the maximum number of items included in the dropdown list when you search for a value. Set '0' to display all. This option has no effect when you click on the dropdown arrow.

maxSelection.description: Limit the number of items the user can select. Set '0' for unlimited.

maxObserved.description: Limit the number of items displayed in the Observer mode. Max 1000.

delimiterForPasting.description: Choose the character used as separator to split pasted text into multiple keywords. Choose 'Carriage return' if you are pasting from Excel.

searchDelimiter.description: Choose the character used as separator to split the input text into multiple keywords.

showObservedCount.description: Show the number of hidden items.

emptyObserverLabel.description: Set the text to display when there are no items.

treeCtrlSelection.description: Allow multiple selections only when CTRL or Command + click is used.

ctrlSelection.description: Allow multiple selections only when CTRL or Command + click is used.

compressMultiple.description: Use a single item to display multiple selected keywords.

compressMultipleAfter.description: Set the number of items allowed before compressing the field.

filterMultiple.description: When multiple fields are connected, you can choose if input boxes filter the others.

crossFiltering.description: 'Every field' filters every field based on the current selection. 'Every field and values' includes values too. 'Sequential' filters the input boxes in the order they appear in the visual. Choose 'Legacy' only if normal behavior doesn't work as expected or as it did before.

autocomplete.description: Automatically complete user input with a suggested keyword. When enabled, only the keywords starting with the input string are included in the dropdown list. Disable to return keywords containing the input string in any position.

autoOpenDropdown.description: Automatically show the dropdown list while typing.

keepDropdown.description: Keep dropdown list open after selecting an item.

logicalOperator.description: Choose the logical operator used to connect the input keywords. If you choose 'Interactive', a special button is displayed inside the input field (Editing/Reading view).

columnsOperator.description: Choose the logical operator used to connect multiple input boxes.

defaultTextCondition.description: Choose how to perform text searches when no wildcards or quotes are defined.

searchOnPaste.description: Perform a search immediately after pasting some values in the text area. If disabled, you can search by using the Apply filter button or pressing CTRL+Enter.

searchOnTyping.description: Perform a search automatically after typing text. If disabled, you can search by using the Apply filter button or pressing CTRL+Enter.

treeShowSelectAll.description: Show a button to select all nodes at once.

treeClickMode.description: Choose how users interact with the visual.

defaultNoFilter.description: Apply a empty filter to the report when no user selection is set. It works only with dates/numeric/textual fields.

enumeration.value: Segoe UI Bold, wf_segoe-ui_bold, helvetica, arial, sans-serif
Segoe UI, wf_segoe-ui_normal, helvetica, arial, sans-serif
Segoe UI Light, wf_segoe-ui_bold, helvetica, arial, sans-serif

inputRows.description: Set the minimum height of the input field(s). Set 0 to automatically fill the size of the visual.

tokenMinWidth.description: Set the minimum width of each selected item. Set 0 to not limit.

tokenMaxWidth.description: Set the maximum width of each selected item. Set 0 to use all the required space.

showApplyFilter.description: Show a button to apply the filter. Note that if the button is hidden, you can always apply the filter by pressing the Enter key in Filter mode or CTRL + Enter in Search mode.

showClear.description: Show a button inside all input fields to clear their content.

showGlobalClear.description: Show a button to clear the contents of all input fields.

showTips.description: Show a button to display a tooltip containing the available syntax.

treeWordWrap.description: Choose how to truncate long node names.

treeShowControls.description: Show a bar with additional controls.

locale.description: Set the culture code used to format data. This code is determined automatically, but you can change it to fit your needs.

enumeration.displayName: English (St Helena, Ascension, Tristan da Cunha)

enumeration.value: Segoe UI Bold, wf_segoe-ui_bold, helvetica, arial, sans-serif
Segoe UI, wf_segoe-ui_normal, helvetica, arial, sans-serif
Segoe UI Light, wf_segoe-ui_bold, helvetica, arial, sans-serif
Segoe UI Bold, wf_segoe-ui_bold, helvetica, arial, sans-serif
Segoe UI, wf_segoe-ui_normal, helvetica, arial, sans-serif
Segoe UI Light, wf_segoe-ui_bold, helvetica, arial, sans-serif

method.description: Choose how to sort data. The default method is the one used by most Power BI visuals – you click on the visual header ellipsis button and choose a column/measure to sort by. By choosing 'Custom', you can define a different sort order for each field.
